intro: Heptapleurum redivivum, commonly known as the evergreen holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pentaphylacaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its dense, glossy, dark green leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. It produces small, inconspicuous yellowish-green flowers followed by bright red berries. Heptapleurum redivivum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
